qas.question: What was the focus of both alliances' policies towards the other in lieu of direct fighting?
Which continent was considered to be at the center of NATO/Warsaw Pact intrigues?
Who waged war against each other for 36 years?
NATO and the US never waged what against each other?

plausible_answers.text: United States and the Soviet Union and their respective allies

qas.question: Who created strategic policies aimed at containment?

plausible_answers.text: United States and the Soviet Union and their respective allies

qas.question: Who fought for influence during WWII?

context: For 36 years, <b2_0>NATO and the Warsaw Pact<b2_0/> never directly waged <b3_0>war<b3_0/> against each other in <a1_0>Europe<a1_0/>; the <b4_0><b5_0>United States and the Soviet Union and their respective allies<b5_0/><b4_0/> implemented strategic policies aimed at the <a0_0>containment<a0_0/> of each other in Europe, while working and fighting for influence within the wider Cold War on the international stage.
